programme.title: Ancient Engineering

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Almost every culture on Earth tells the story of an ancient flood – details vary but the basic plot is the same - An angry God wipes out an unrepentant population.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: The Earth is built to last. It is a 4,550,000,000-year-old, 5,973,600,000,000,000,000,000-tonne ball of rock and iron. It has taken more devastating asteroid hits in its lifetime than you've had hot dinners, and it still orbits happily around the sun.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: The Rockies. Magnificent and awe-inspiring mysterious, the Rockies are one of the longest mountain ranges in the world. Naked Science investigates the geological processes that build these massive mountains.

programme.title: Naked Science
programme.desc: Mars our closest neighbor now a lifeless planet – but it may once have had water and therefore life. Naked Science investigates the red planet to learn how it was formed, how it became barren, and ask whether it ever will be possible to colonize it?

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: From There to Here
programme.desc: The sky above is studded with stars and countless galaxies. In them, we can read not only our origin, but also our final destination. Technology is on the brink of taking us to places we have only dreamed of.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Gas Giants
programme.desc: In the cold, dark expanse of our solar system, beyond the asteroid belt, lie the giant planets. Some can be seen with the naked eye, others have been visited by our camera. What secrets do they hold?

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Gas Giants
programme.desc: In the cold, dark expanse of our solar system, beyond the asteroid belt, lie the giant planets. Some can be seen with the naked eye, others have been visited by our camera. What secrets do they hold?

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Astronauts
programme.desc: Who are these people that venture into space? Once they were test pilots, then scientists and engineers now teachers, politicians and paying tourists what does it take to earn the astronaut wings?

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Living with Space
programme.desc: Astronauts and Cosmonauts train and study for years to work and live aboard the International Space Station. With this wealth of experience and insight behind them what do they think when they return to Earth?

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: The Dark Side
programme.desc: In terms of the Universe, we know we don't know much, especially when it comes to dark matter and dark energy. Scientists are devoting so much of their time to discovering as much as the possibly can about this mysterious matter.

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: From There to Here

programme.title: Space: The New Frontier: Return to the Moon
programme.desc: The moon is our closest celestial companion. It lights our night sky and gently tugs at our shores. Few have walked on her surface, but her allure remains strong.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: With approximately 130 active volcanoes, Indonesia is arguably the most active place on earth. Volcanologist Tom Pfeiffer leads an expedition to some of Indonesia most remote and rarely visited volcanos.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Volcanic folklore is reflected in Mexican history. One of their ancient legends tells the story of the Aztec warrior Popocatépetl - a giant active volcano - who erupts to wake his sleeping princess Iztaccíhuatl, a neighboring extinct ice capped volcano.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: In Indonesia we find regions where the air is so toxic that it's 40 times above human safe levels and sulphuric acid vents from the ground in dense yellowish clouds. Elsewhere, small volcanoes are so active, they are said to erupt every 15 minutes!

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: Japan is going through a seismic crisis after the devastating Tsunami of 2011. We look closely at two very dangerous volcanoes; both are considered to be in the top 5 most dangerous on the planet.

programme.title: Volcanic Odysseys
programme.desc: For people who live on active volcanoes, life has an element of impermanence to it. There is always the fear that one day their turn will come, and their home will be in the path of the volcano.
programme.sub-title: In the Path of a Volcano

programme.title: Supersize Structures
programme.desc: Explore the tallest towers, the biggest palaces, the grandest tombs and ancient temples that were forgotten for centuries. This episode shows how technique, technology, and ambition have developed some of the most magnificent structures in the world.

programme.title: Supersize Structures
programme.desc: The human race is constantly looking for a better way to get from point A to point B. From tall ships to the invention of the automobile, travel has always been a necessity.

programme.title: Supersize Structures
programme.desc: People have labored on some gigantic undertakings such as roads, bridges, and canals that link oceans. These feats of engineering have allowed cities to grow, but now they are also allowing us to travel into space.

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House
programme.desc: Wide floorboards are installed to match the existing wood in the house. A sink is fabricated out of soapstone, and a backsplash is fabricated from an old board. Lighting installation wraps up.

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: This Old House

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Durante su visita a Los Ángeles, el chef Ramsay se detiene en Capri. Este restaurante italiano está sucio, sirve comida terrible y está desordenado, todo gracias a un par de gemelos muy flojos.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay viaja a Pasadena, California, para poner en forma un restaurante especializado en cocina caribeña. Contiene lenguaje para adultos.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Abajo, en Big Easy, el chef Ramsay intenta inyectar algo de vida en un restaurante sureño acosado por una decoración y menús atroces. Contiene lenguaje para adultos.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay regresa a algunos de los restaurantes para ver si siguieron su consejo. Los restaurantes que visita incluyen Mojito, The Junction y Bazzini. Contiene lenguaje para adultos.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay regresa a Lido di Manhattan, Anna Vincenzo's y Le Bistro para ver si los propietarios han implementado sus cambios. Contiene lenguaje para adultos.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: "The Secret Garden" es un romántico restaurante francés que está al borde de la quiebra. El chef Ramsay causa revuelo cuando sugiere cambiar la decoración fea, el menú y la cocina sucia.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Lela's es un restaurante exclusivo que desesperadamente necesita más clientela.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Sebastian's prepara comida congelada de un menú complejo y los meseros están más preocupados por las audiciones para sus papeles de actuación que por servir las comidas.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay visita el Finn McCool's manejado por una familia en Westhampton, Nueva York, y se enfrenta a un detestable jefe de cocina que resulta ser el hijo del propietario.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: Ubicado en Bellmore, Nueva York, The Mixing Bowl enfrenta una afluencia de competencia y apenas tiene clientes.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español
programme.desc: El chef Ramsay debe trabajar con un chef testarudo y propietarios sin experiencia para realizar algunos cambios y traer de vuelta a los clientes a Seascape.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares en español

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: There seems to be a cookie to fit any occasion or mood. In this episode we look at two from opposite ends of the style spectrum—the thick, homey oatmeal and the dainty, elegant spritz.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: In this episode, we aim to resurrect the traditional birthday cake. We've developed an honest-to-goodness layer cake with an old-fashioned jam filling and real butter frosting—the type of cake guaranteed to put a smile on anyone's face.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: German chocolate cake—filled with sticky pecans and coconut—is not without flaws. We set out to develop a German chocolate cake that avoids the common pitfalls and delivers on its promise.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We set out to make a meatloaf with well-seasoned meat and just enough binder to give the loaf a tender, not tough, texture. In choosing a side dish to partner with our meatloaf, we turned to another old-fashioned dish—skillet-roasted potatoes.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bryan Roof makes Julia Collin Davison Greek Chicken. Jack Bishop challenges Bridget Lancaster to a tasting of crumbled feta, and Adam Ried reviews liquid measuring cups. Lawman Johnson makes Crushed Red Potatoes with Garlic & Herbs.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Hosts Julia Collin Davison and Bridget Lancaster make Cheesy Stuffed Shells. Equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for 13 by 9-inch broiler-safe baking dishes. Bryan Roof makes Julia Eggplant Pecorino.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bryan Roof makes host Bridget Lancaster One-Batch Fried Chicken. Tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Julia Collin Davison to a tasting of strawberry spreads. Christie Morrison makes North Carolina Cheese Biscuits.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bryan Roof makes host Bridget Lancaster Pennsylvania Dutch Apple Pie. Tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Julia Collin Davison to a tasting of vanilla ice cream. Bridget and Julia bake Amish Cinnamon Bread.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Bryan Roof makes host Julia Collin Davison Bottom Round Roast Beef with Zip-Style Sauce. Equipment expert Adam Ried reveals his top pick for measuring spoons. Christie Morrison makes host Bridget Lancaster Almond Boneless Chicken.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Christie Morrison and host Bridget Lancaster make Triple-Chocolate Sticky Buns. Tasting expert Jack Bishop challenges host Julia Collin Davison to a tasting of milk chocolate. Morgan Bolling makes Thin and Crispy Chocolate Chip Cookies.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Host Bridget Lancaster makes Popcorn Chicken, & Toni Tipton-Martin talks about the snack's inventor. Equipment expert Adam Ried reviews electric deep-fryers. Bryan Roof makes Gobi Manchurian & Lawman Johnson makes Crispy Vegetable Fritters.

programme.title: Cook's Country
programme.desc: Host Julia Collin Davison makes Green Goddess Roast Chicken, and Toni Tipton-Martin shares the origins of green goddess dressing. Tasting expert Jack Bishop gives a primer on herbs. Ashley Moore makes Potato, Green Bean, and Tomato Salad.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia shares her recipe for easy broiled salmon with mustard and crisp dilled crust, orzo salad with cucumber, red onion, and mint, plus a pretty and pink berry fool for dessert

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia's take on comfort food includes thick-cut pork chops with smoked sea salt, garlic-scented mashed sweet potatoes with coconut milk and cilantro, a brussels sprouts and kale salad with herbs and peanuts, and her slow-cooker nutella bread pudding.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia whips up her favorite Bloody Marys with fresh horseradish and homemade cocktail onions plus sheet-pan hash browns for a crowd and springy green Shakshuka.

programme.title: Julia at Home
programme.desc: Julia resizes Italian classics for families of two or three, starting with a meaty loaf-pan lasagna, crispy artichoke salad with lemon vinaigrette, and a scaled-down version of creamy tiramisu.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Dinners prepared entirely in one skillet are perfect for weeknight cooking. Less cleanup is one obvious benefit. A skillet also gives the cook a bit more control over cooking multiple elements.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Beef, beer, and onions have a natural affinity—it's one reason burgers and onion rings are often on bar menus. In a carbonnade, the beef melds with the soft sweetness of sliced onions in a lightly thickened broth that is rich, deep, and satisfying.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted a streamlined version of roast chicken with plenty of stuffing to go around. First, we needed to solve the problem of cooking the stuffing to a safe temperature without drying out the delicate breast meat of the chicken.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Boneless pork chops are lean and quick-cooking, making them ideal for weeknight meals. Pork tenderloin, which is also lean, has a somewhat fussy reputation, but you don't need to be a professional chef to cook tenderloin properly.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We make a fresh-tasting, quick tamale pie with a juicy, spicy mixture of meat and vegetables and a quick homemade-cornbread topping. We also show you how to cook up a really flavorful chicken stew topped with a biscuit crust.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Whether we admit it or not, there are some dishes that are a little too high in fat and calories to be enjoyed on a regular basis. Even a modest portion of macaroni and cheese or chicken Parmesan is prohibitive. But that doesn't need to be the case.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We wanted to be able to serve English-style fish and chips—large pieces of moist and delicate cod in a crisp and tender coating with thick-cut fries—at home.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Commonly found at catered events, this once-highbrow dish has become a bit of a joke. But after preparing several cookbook versions, we realized that pairing a crisp-fried coating with a delicate butter sauce was a great idea that deserved a revival.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: While the hallmark of this filet mignon is its tender texture, some argue that the beefy flavor is too mild, lacking the oomph of fattier cuts like rib eye. So we aim to boost the filet mignon's flavor with a peppercorn crust and a rich pan sauce.

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: We love a good stir-fry served with rice, but a noodle cake, a savory round of tender noodles sautéed in a skillet until the exterior is crisp, is also a great base for a saucy stir-fry.
programme.sub-title: Stir-Fried Chicken with Crispy Noodle Cake

programme.desc: We prepare a Thai-inspired beef stir-fry and share a recipe for great potstickers.

programme.desc: Host Bridget Lancaster makes One-Pot Chicken Jardinière, and Toni Tipton-Martin shares the history of cooking in one pot. Equipment expert Adam Ried reviews paring knives. Morgan Bolling makes One-Pan Mediterranean Shrimp.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: A pit bull is aggressive toward people and dogs; a dachshund mix exhibits aggression at feeding time and when it comes time to trim his nails.

programme.title: Dog Whisperer
programme.desc: Cesar Millan investigates the case of a bulldog named Bella who has become aggressive ever since her owner's five-month rehab stint.

programme.title: Macaque Island

programme.title: Islands: Nature's Wild Laboratories

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.desc: Observe the islands' natural rhythms and the challenges of bringing forth new life in this wild outpost; watch as turtles return to their nesting sites, rival iguanas butt heads to win a new mate, and albatrosses conduct sweet courtship dances.

programme.title: Kui Buri: Thailand's Hidden Eden

programme.desc: A strange old woman allows a teenage runaway and a young orphan to stay in an abandoned house overlooking the sea. However, when a menacing entity threatens their new home, they must band together and face their fears to save it.

programme.title: The Princess and the Pilot
programme.desc: In this anime tale, a top pilot must brave treacherous waters and death-defying danger to bring a princess to a royal palace.

programme.desc: A curse placed on Lum as an infant manifests itself in the present day, causing her to be taken to another dimension. Lum's husband, Ataru Moroboshi is turned into a hippo, and attempts to find Lum with the help of her friends.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura 4: Lum the Forever
programme.desc: When a great cherry tree, Tarozakura is cut down while Lum & Co. are making a movie, Lum loses her horns-and her powers! Thus begins the strangest and most lyrical of the Urusei Yatsura movies...

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura 5: The Final Chapter
programme.desc: Lupa, yet another one of Lum's fiancés, arrives on the scene, and Lum and Ataru have to repeat their game of tag in order to prevent the Earth from being destroyed.

programme.title: Urusei Yatsura 6: Always My Darling
programme.desc: Lupica, another one of the legion of space princesses that all seem to have found out about Earth in some tour book, appears and abducts Ataru!

programme.title: Redemption

programme.title: The Hummingbird Project
programme.desc: A pair of high-frequency traders go up against their old boss in an effort to make millions in a fibre-optic cable deal.

programme.title: London Heist
programme.desc: A bank heist goes bad and someone is murdered, but things may not be all they seem.

programme.title: Cybermutt
programme.desc: The powerful dog Rex is injured by a car while rescuing a young scientist from being run over. Feeling responsible for the condition of Rex the scientist uses his skill as a prosthetics inventor to give the dog a new, super-power body.

programme.title: Timber The Treasure Dog
programme.desc: A local villain is buying up all the ranches where 12-year-old Mickey and his family live, unless they can find a small fortune, they will lose theirs. Luckily, Mickeys dog Timber holds the clue to a legend of buried treasure.

programme.title: The Simple Life of Noah Dearborn
programme.desc: Academy Award winners Sidney Poitier and Dianne Wiest star with Mary-Louise Parker in this enchanting tale about a quiet hero who becomes the talk of the town.

programme.title: F.R.E.D.I.
programme.desc: Prepare for an adventure that's out of this world! When an intelligent, lovable robot, known as F.R.E.D.I., goes missing from a secret government research facility it's found by 15 year old James.

programme.title: The Adventurer: Curse of the Midas Box
programme.desc: Transporting you to a rambunctious realm of enchanting fantasy. When Mariah's little brother is kidnapped, he follows a trail of clues to discover a hidden realm of monsters, ancient secrets and a long-lost artefact. Feat: Michael Sheen & Sam Neill.

programme.title: Not to Forget
programme.desc: After a life of little scams, a self-centered millennial is sentenced to take care of his grandmother, who is affected by Alzheimer's. As he realizes the extent of her wealth, the protagonist gets closer to the treasure he's been looking for.

programme.title: Storm Boy
programme.desc: When Michael Kingley, a successful retired businessman starts to see images from his past that he can't explain, he's forced to remember his childhood and how, as a boy, he rescued and raised an extraordinary orphaned pelican, Mr Percival.

programme.title: Labyrinth
programme.desc: Sixteen-year-old Sarah must solve a labyrinth to rescue her baby brother when he is taken by the Goblin King.

programme.title: To the Ends of Time
programme.desc: In a mythical kingdom, a young boy must fight time itself for the love of his princess and the future of his land.

programme.title: Foster
programme.desc: A heart-warming story of family and friendship starring Academy Award Nominee Toni Collette and Ioan Gruffudd.

programme.title: George And The Dragon
programme.desc: A knight (James Purefoy, "Rome") returning from the Crusades takes on a dragon after the disappearance of the kindly Princess Lunna (Piper Perabo, "Coyote Ugly"). With Patrick Swayze.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Storm Warning
programme.desc: A storm is racing towards the north Atlantic fishing grounds, but with time ticking away on the bluefin tuna season, the captains have no choice but to head out to fish in the rough weather.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Hell On The High Seas
programme.desc: It is week eight of the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna fishing season, and cracks are starting to show in the Gloucester fleet, with captains and crews pushing each other to the limit.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Meltdown
programme.desc: Tensions reach their breaking point amongst the Gloucester fleet as captains, mates and vessels fall apart.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Captain Carnage
programme.desc: It's a battle of wills on the North Atlantic, as two of Gloucester's top Bluefin fishermen - friends-turned-foes Paul Hebert and Dave Carraro - go head-to-head to out-fish each other.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: All Hands On Deck
programme.desc: With only four weeks left in the Atlantic Bluefin season, two boats have the challenge of novice fishermen on board – and it could make or break their season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Uncharted Territory
programme.desc: The Atlantic Bluefin are starting to migrate out of New England waters, so the Gloucester fleet races to find any edge they can, but will their risky new strategies pay off?

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Twice Bitten
programme.desc: With only two weeks left on the North Atlantic Bluefin tuna fishing season, just one fish is not enough for the Gloucester captains – and the lure of doubling their luck is overpowering.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Money On The Line
programme.desc: In the first episode of a two-part season finale, Gloucester's reigning Bluefin champion Dave Carraro, of FV-tuna.com, starts the fishing season with a $20,000 lead over his rival.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Endgame
programme.desc: With only three days left in the North Atlantic Bluefin Tuna season, the captains of Gloucester race against each other - and an oncoming storm - in the battle to land their final fish of the season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Back In The Hunt
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, head for open seas in hopes of catching the first fish of the Atlantic Bluefin Tuna Season.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Go Fish!
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle for the elusive and lucrative giant Bluefin tuna, with harpooners going up against rod-and-reelers.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: The Numbers War
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester battle for prime fishing spots in their quest to catch the elusive and lucrative Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Fish Fight
programme.desc: For the tuna fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, it's tournament time, and, with a big cash prize up for grabs, the fight is on to catch the biggest bluefin.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Shark Attack
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, are facing a dangerous new foe, with great white sharks swarming into local waters.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Sweet Smell of Revenge
programme.desc: The fishermen of Gloucester, Massachusetts, battle droves of bumbling amateur fishermen in their bid to catch lucrative Atlantic Bluefin Tuna.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna: Storm Warning
programme.desc: A storm is racing towards the north Atlantic fishing grounds, but with time ticking away on the bluefin tuna season, the captains have no choice but to head out to fish in the rough weather.

programme.title: Marketplace Middle East
programme.desc: Kurdistan, Iraq emerges as an economic powerhouse and tourism destination, attracting global attention with stunning landscapes, rich history, and growing business opportunities.

programme.title: One World With Zain Asher and Bianna Golodryga
programme.desc: A fresh and inclusive take on the top stories from Africa, Europe and beyond, giving every continent an equal voice.

programme.title: The Song of Names
programme.desc: Several years after his childhood friend, a violin prodigy, disappears on the eve of his first solo concert, an Englishman travels throughout Europe to find him.

programme.title: Journey's End
programme.desc: Set over 4 days in March 1918 in the trenches on the front line, a small group of soldiers wait to be bombarded by enemy artillery and certain death.

programme.title: Their Finest
programme.desc: A British film crew attempts to boost morale during World War II by making a propaganda film after the Blitzkrieg.

programme.title: Journey's End
programme.desc: Set over 4 days in March 1918 in the trenches on the front line, a small group of soldiers wait to be bombarded by enemy artillery and certain death.

programme.title: The Song of Names
programme.desc: Several years after his childhood friend, a violin prodigy, disappears on the eve of his first solo concert, an Englishman travels throughout Europe to find him.

programme.title: American Hangman
programme.desc: An unidentified man posts a live feed on social media showing that he has kidnapped two strangers and intends to kill one before the day is out. His intention is to hold a capital 'trial' online, with the public acting as judge and jury.

programme.title: Denial
programme.desc: Acclaimed writer and historian Deborah E. Lipstadt must seek historical truth to demonstrate that the Holocaust actually occurred when David Irving, a renowned Holocaust denier, called it to fame.

programme.title: The Unexpected Journey
programme.desc: Based on a true story, a mother struggles to raise twin autistic sons in a society where the odds of her succeeding are poor.

programme.title: The Weekend
programme.desc: A comedian goes away for the weekend with an ex-boyfriend and his new girlfriend.

programme.title: Last Knights
programme.desc: A fallen warrior rises against a corrupt and sadistic ruler to avenge his dishonoured master.

programme.title: Sweet Virginia
programme.desc: A former rodeo champ befriends a young man with a propensity for violence.

programme.title: Free State of Jones
programme.desc: Free State of Jones is an epic action-drama set during the Civil War, and tells the story of defiant Southern farmer, Newt Knight (McConaughey), and his extraordinary armed rebellion against the Confederacy.

programme.title: Sweet Virginia
programme.desc: A former rodeo champ befriends a young man with a propensity for violence.

programme.title: Free State of Jones
programme.desc: Free State of Jones is an epic action-drama set during the Civil War, and tells the story of defiant Southern farmer, Newt Knight (McConaughey), and his extraordinary armed rebellion against the Confederacy.

programme.title: Collision Earth
programme.desc: A giant asteroid threatens to destroy Earth after military protocols designed to stop the impact fail.

programme.title: Mega Shark vs Crocosaurus
programme.desc: The massive prehistoric shark has survived the last battle, and the world is again threatened when a new, more dangerous foe is discovered in the jungles of Africa.

programme.title: Sniper's eye: Fortress
programme.desc: After retired CIA agent Robert Carter Michaels (Bruce Willis) and his son Paul (Jesse Metcalfe) defended the highly secured secret base ‘The Fortress’ against elite criminal Frederic Balzary (Chad Michael Murray), they are thrust back into action.

programme.title: Backtrace
programme.desc: The lone surviving thief of a violent armored car robbery is sprung from a high security facility and administered an experimental drug.

programme.title: PRIMAL
programme.desc: A collector of rare and exotic cats (Nicolas Cage) finds himself in the hunt of his life when a deadly political assassin overruns the ship transporting his priceless animal.

programme.title: Imaginary Heroes
programme.desc: In this emotional drama, members of a dysfunctional family react differently to the suicide of the eldest son. Featuring an all-star cast including Sigourney Weaver, Jeff Daniels, Emile Hirsch, Michelle Williams and Kip Pardue.

programme.title: Serving Sara
programme.desc: Joe Tyler is a process server who will do anything to deliver legal documents to victims. But nothing in Joe's bag of tricks prepares him for Sara, the stunning, soon-to-be ex-wife of a playboy cattle baron named Gordon Moore.

programme.title: The Reality of Love
programme.desc: The manager (Bradley Cooper) of a sinking idol (Jason Priestley) tries to revive his career.

programme.title: Serving Sara
programme.desc: Joe Tyler is a process server who will do anything to deliver legal documents to victims. But nothing in Joe's bag of tricks prepares him for Sara, the stunning, soon-to-be ex-wife of a playboy cattle baron named Gordon Moore.

programme.title: The Reality of Love
programme.desc: The manager (Bradley Cooper) of a sinking idol (Jason Priestley) tries to revive his career.

programme.title: Are You Here
programme.desc: Two childhood best friends embark on a road trip back to their hometown after one of them learns he has inherited a large sum of money from his recently deceased estranged father.

programme.title: Just My Luck
programme.desc: Sexy Manhattanite Ashley is known as the luckiest woman around, but after a chance romantic encounter with down-and-out Jake, she realizes that she's swapped her fortune for his.

programme.title: Mozart and the Whale
programme.desc: Starring Josh Hartnett and Radha Mitchell, this heartwarming romantic drama is inspired by the true story of two people with Asperger's syndrome, whose emotional dysfunctions threaten to sabotage their budding romance.

programme.title: BUFFALOED
programme.desc: Set in the underworld of debt-collecting, overachiever and hustler Peg Dahl (Zoey Deutch), finds quick success, making her the target of a violent competitor.

programme.title: Walking The Dog
programme.desc: Rival lawyers battle each other in court as their respective dogs fall madly in love, bringing their guardians together at every turn until they reluctantly realize it may not just be the pups who are each other's true Valentine.

programme.title: Don’t Forget I Love You
programme.desc: Taylor opens a time capsule left by her late mother, which contains six envelopes. In each one is a challenge that her mother hopes she can complete to push her out of her comfort zone.

programme.title: Flower Shop Mystery: Dearly Depotted
programme.desc: Abby Knight, ex-lawyer, crime buff and owner of Bloomers Flower Shop, is having a week to be reckoned with. A reluctant bridesmaid at wedding, Abby ends up not just doing the flowers, but having to solve a murder.

programme.title: High Flying Romance
programme.desc: Hannah falls for more than teaching music when woodworker Gavin and his nine-year-old daughter, Parker, move back to town after his wife’s passing. With a shared interest in the upcoming kite festival...

programme.title: A Second Chance at Love
programme.desc: Alicia and Arnold's marriage is amiss. Rather than face the problem, Alicia immerses herself in her divorced parents' affairs by setting them up on a dating app.

programme.title: Tulips in Spring
programme.desc: An interior designer must halt her work on a big project in order to return home and assist her injured father at her family's tulip farm in rural Washington state.

programme.title: Loves Second Chance
programme.desc: When Rose, a passionate fashion stylist in her 30's living in New York, inherits her grandmother's vintage dress shop, she returns to her small hometown to take care of the store.

programme.title: Once Upon a Prince
programme.desc: Susanna gladly accepts help one day from handsome stranger Nate at her parents’ garden store in small-town Georgia.

programme.title: When Sparks Fly
programme.desc: A big city journalist is sent back to her small hometown to write a Fourth of July story and discovers the life and love she left behind are exactly what she's been missing.

programme.title: The Wedding Veil Journey
programme.desc: Tracy and Nick agree to set aside work to make time for a long overdue honeymoon to Greece. When they are stranded on a secluded island, they confront their life choices.

programme.title: Sense, Sensibility and Snowmen
programme.desc: Ella and her sister Marianne are HUGE Christmas enthusiasts and own a party planning business. One of their new clients is a toy company and they don't see eye-to-eye with Edward, the company's CEO.

programme.title: Finding Father Christmas
programme.desc: Christmas for Miranda is a painful reminder of the family she never had. Her mother died when she was young, never revealing the identity of her father. But, three days before Christmas, she unexpectedly receives a clue.

programme.title: A Christmas Treasure
programme.desc: After opening a 100-year-old time capsule and meeting a charming chef, Lou questions whether or not she should move to New York after Christmas and further her writing career.

programme.title: The Mistletoe Promise
programme.desc: Elise Donner is a thirtysomething divorcee who runs a busy travel agency alongside her intractable ex-husband, Dan, who objects to her combining a charitable outreach program with their business.

programme.title: Candy Cane Christmas
programme.desc: As Phoebe is searching for a new tradition to lift her holiday spirits, she realizes that it's not the traditions we cherish, but the people with whom we share them.

programme.title: Lights, Camera, Christmas!
programme.desc: When a holiday rom-com movie shooting in her town needs a costume designer, Kerry, a local shop owner, steps into the role. While working on the movie, she rediscovers her passion for costume design.

programme.title: The Christmas Contest
programme.desc: Exes Lara and Ben compete in a Christmas contest to win money for the charity of their choosing. The city watches them battle and choose what is more important, victory or love.

programme.title: Nantucket Noel
programme.desc: During the Seaside Noel celebrations Christina learns of a developer who is planning to tear down the wharf that is home to her toy store. Tensions rise as she falls for the developer's son, Andy.

programme.title: Four Christmases and a Wedding

programme.title: Christmas Scavenger Hunt

programme.title: Monty Python's Flying Circus

programme.title: King of the Mountains - Golden Eagle
programme.desc: Aerial shots of mating Golden eagles, a clash between a Golden and a White-tailed eagle, and an intimate glimpse into their nesting grounds combine to create a spectacular film. Tracking these majestic birds reveals the wild nature of their hunting grounds, showcasing the diverse animal and plant life that share their habitat with the 'king of the skies.' Viewers are brought up close as the eagle effortlessly glides over forests and canyons, abruptly diving in a breathtaking pursuit of prey. Witnessing these birds in their natural habitats is witnessing them at their finest. Embark on a magnificent journey through the skies and landscapes with us.

programme.title: King of the Seas - Sea Eagle
programme.desc: The times where eagles have been seen as varmints are over. They are now perceived as an integral part of the food cycle. Due to the fact that the habitats of the sea eagles in Germany are largely found in the north-eastern regions that are rich in water, the movie accompanies the eagles to an island, home to hundreds of sea ravens, where they rob the baby sea ravens of their food. They seem to always profit from the successes of the fellow creatures in their habitats. This film introduces you to the expert poachers of the animal kingdom.

programme.title: Wilderness in Europe: The Bohemian Forest
programme.sub-title: The Psychogramm of a Spiritual Landscape
programme.desc: The Bohemian Forest is the source of the Vltava River, home to primeval forests, untouched high moors and bubbling torrents. This archaic stretch of land, which includes the Bavarian Forest, was long considered impenetrable and mysterious. Since the fall of the Iron Curtain, Bavarian border residents have rediscovered new references to this unusual forest landscape for themselves. This is also the case with photo artist Bastian Kalous, who has been documenting his homeland for years with nostalgic-looking Polaroid photographs and is dealing with its eventful history for an illustrated book. Or Elisa Belotti and Marco Heurich, who have dedicated their lives to the lynxes. In order for Europe's largest wild cat to survive in the Bohemian Forest, the lynx researchers fight for every single animal. Iryna Rudenko came to Zwiesel from Ukraine out of a passion for glass as a material to study at the glass school. After graduation, she would like to stay in Bavaria, Anna Hones grew up in Horská Kvilda, the smallest and highest village in the Czech Republic. The village lies just under 1100 meters above sea level, directly on the former border. The farmer, who experienced communism, the fall of the Iron Curtain and the subsequent changes, is now trying to find ways of surviving in this barren region with her children.

programme.title: Wild Bavaria
programme.desc: The moon disappears behind the horizon and the stage is set for a new day in the Alps of Berchtesgaden.

programme.title: Wild Bavaria
programme.sub-title: Wild Bavaria - In The Shadow of the Watzmann.
programme.desc: Mighty and mysterious, King Watzmann sits above Germany's only alpine national park.

programme.title: Wild River Rhine
programme.desc: Alluvial forests, roaring waterfalls, steep canyons and sunny slopes flank the river Rhine. The variety of habitats is the reason for the large biodiversity along the stream.There is hardly any other river in Germany that is surrounded by as many myths and legends as the river Rhine. No other river has been the topic of songs, has been painted and travelled equally frequently. Despite this it still seems to be true today what the French poet Victor Hugo once said about this river – the Rhine is a river everybody talks about, nobody explores, everybody visits but no one really knows. The film follows the water against the stream. It starts at the river’s delta in the Netherlands, flows through six countries and ends in the Swiss Alps.

programme.title: The Moor
programme.desc: Moors and peatlands are oases in the cultivated landscape of Central Europe.

programme.title: Treasure of Lima - Buried Exhibition
programme.desc: This is a story about a remote island in the pacific.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: The Parque Nacional Peneda-Gerês is the only national park in Portugal. An area of almost 700 square kilometers, located in the extreme north of Portugal. Barren and rocky ridges in the plateaus, contrast with large forests and lush ground vegetation in deep valleys, crossed by lakes and rivers. The park is known for its oak forests, which are predominantly pedunculate and Pyrenean oaks. Among the typical animals of the park are the small Garrano ponies, a very old breed of horse and the only one in Europe that still lives in the wild.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: The highest mountain range in Portugal is the Serra da Estrela. The episode embarks on a voyage of discovery to adventurous rock formations and villages steeped in tradition. The nature park is the largest protected area on the Iberian peninsula. In the mountain range we accompany the young scientist Ana Matos, who wants to breathe new life into old traditions, and cheese maker Maria Natália Lopes. She watches over more than 350 sheeps.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.sub-title: South West Portugal: Alentejano and Costa Vicentina
programme.desc: In the southwest of Portugal lies the little known Parque Natural do Sudoeste Alentejano e Costa Vicentina. It encompasses a narrow coastal strip that runs along the coast to the south of Portugal. Sparsely populated, this coastal region, which was placed under protection in 1988, is considered one of the last intact ecosystems in Europe. The steep cliffs, the almost constant wind and high waves have ensured that mass tourism has not gained a foothold here. There are still near-natural forests and a diverse bird life.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: Madeira - Portugal's autonomous island in the Atlantic Ocean, is closer to the African coast than to the mother country Portugal, from which it is separated by about 900 kilometers. The island's name comes from Portuguese sailors who claimed the uninhabited isle for themselves in 1419. Madeira means wood and that was available in abundance. Almost the entire surface was covered by dense forest. Since 1982, two-thirds of the landscape has been protected.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: The "Parque Natural da Ria Formosa" is one of the largest lagoon conservation areas in Europe. Bordered by five natural islands. A mosaic of sandbanks, brackish and freshwater lagoons and salt marshes. In 2010, the "Ria Formosa" was chosen as one of the seven natural wonders of Portugal. It is a unique ecosystem: in the winter months, more than 20,000 birds gather here. In addition, the nature park has one of the largest seahorse populations internationally. More than half of all fish species in the Atlantic are said to spawn in the lagoon.

programme.title: Symphony of the Seas - Underwater Wonders of Australia's Ocean
programme.desc: Our journeys take us all around the world from Patagonia to the USA, from Greenland to South Africa and from Cambodia to Australia and leads us to the most fascinating places where landscapes animals and humans are the main focus of our documentaries. Whether on land or at sea – the last paradises of the world are our destination.

programme.title: Bosnia Herzegovina
programme.desc: Wild and unknown lies the still undiscovered natural paradise of Bosnia and Herzegovina in the heart of Europe. Rough mountains, dense forests and wild waterfalls characterize the picture of the untouched landscapes. Lynx, wolves and bears roam mountains and valleys. One of the last primeval forests in Europe is a retreat for many endangered animal species. Bosnia and Herzegovina is actually an undiscovered natural paradise in the middle of Europe.

programme.title: Bosnia Herzegovina
programme.desc: The barren, karstic south of the country, Herzegovina, also impresses with its natural landscapes. One of them is the Livno field. Not only is it the largest wetland in the country, it is also the largest regularly flooded karst field in the world. About 700 wild horses live in this unique landscape. Their ancestors were working horses that were abandoned here more than 50 years ago. Another special feature of the karst landscape are the rivers with their tufa barriers. The countless waterfalls that pour over it are a unique natural phenomenon.

programme.title: Wilderness in Europe: The Bohemian Forest
programme.desc: Pavel Hubeny, whose life would be unthinkable without the forest, is the head of the Šumava National Park. He is committed to ensuring that a primeval forest can grow for future generations, in which man does not interfere. This vision of a primeval forest is also shared by the forester Claus Bässler, who wants to counteract the extinction of species by having trees felled to create artificial deadwood and thus a new habitat for rare beetles and fungi. On the Vltava River lies the small town of Krumlov, the "Pearl of the Bohemian Forest" with its Baroque theater and fully preserved stage technology from the 17th century. Here the director Zuzana Vrbová enchants people from all over the world with her productions. Apart from agriculture, it was mainly the abundance of forests that ensured the livelihood of the inhabitants of the Bohemian Forest - including that of the carpenter Philipp von Manz, who processed local wood for his customers all over Germany. Veterinarian Judith Gollner, who grew up in the Austrian part of the Bohemian Forest, lived in Vienna for a long time and made a conscious decision to return. She likes the people and is proud of "her farmers' wives" who share her love of the Bohemian Forest.

programme.desc: The Parque Nacional Peneda-Gerês is the only national park in Portugal. An area of almost 700 square kilometers, located in the extreme north of Portugal. Barren and rocky ridges in the plateaus, contrast with large forests and lush ground vegetation in deep valleys, crossed by lakes and rivers. The park is known for its oak forests, which are predominantly pedunculate and Pyrenean oaks. Among the typical animals of the park are the small Garrano ponies, a very old breed of horse and the only one in Europe that still lives in the wild.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.desc: The highest mountain range in Portugal is the Serra da Estrela. The episode embarks on a voyage of discovery to adventurous rock formations and villages steeped in tradition. The nature park is the largest protected area on the Iberian peninsula. In the mountain range we accompany the young scientist Ana Matos, who wants to breathe new life into old traditions, and cheese maker Maria Natália Lopes. She watches over more than 350 sheeps.

programme.title: Portugal's Nature Parks
programme.sub-title: South West Portugal: Alentejano and Costa Vicentina
programme.desc: In the southwest of Portugal lies the little known Parque Natural do Sudoeste Alentejano e Costa Vicentina. It encompasses a narrow coastal strip that runs along the coast to the south of Portugal. Sparsely populated, this coastal region, which was placed under protection in 1988, is considered one of the last intact ecosystems in Europe. The steep cliffs, the almost constant wind and high waves have ensured that mass tourism has not gained a foothold here. There are still near-natural forests and a diverse bird life.
